sermons.title: "To the Jew First..."
sermons.description: The church is emaciated and corrupted in exact proportion as it has failed to take to heart God’s foremost mandate for herself, namely, that “the gospel is the power of God unto salvation for all who believe, to the Jew first…”  There is a divine wisdom here that the Lord wants to bring to our attention.

sermons.title: (1 Peter - Part 12): As Obedient Children
sermons.description: This lesson is on the necessity of obedience in a Christian life. Also how as Christians following God we can be much happier than not following God.

sermons.title: (1 Peter - Part 13): On Fashioning Ourselves as Christians
sermons.description: This is a sermon on being fashioned not after the world but after Christ. Tozer gives a thorough list of factors which will fashion our lives, whether for the good or bad. This sermon speaks of our lives before our being born again and how we need to fashion our lives according to our new nature which is holy in all conversation. God is holy and our walk as Christians need to be holy to as Tozer mentions.

sermons.title: (1 Peter - Part 27): Who is He That Will Harm you?
sermons.description: A. W. Tozer strikes a blow against fear. With searing eloquence and sober erudition, Dr. Tozer sets forth an extremely encouraging message for all of Christ’s servants and missionaries. He starts by taking us through Romans 8:33-39 to underscore the bold exhortation of 1 Peter 3:13. Nothing can harm a good man! “Nothing can debase his quality, nothing can reduce his dimensions, nothing can prevent the fulfillment of his destiny, nothing can block the accomplishment of his appointed task, and nothing can lower his value before God and the universe!” With this May 16, 1954 sermon, Pastor Tozer marked one year from the beginning of his 34-part series on Peter’s first epistle. “Who is He That Will Harm You?” is the 27th message, preached at Southside Alliance Church in Chicago, Illinois. It is 38 minutes, 43 seconds in length.

sermons.title: (Bible Analysis Of Man) Man's Body Immortal - Part 1
(Education for Exultation) Let All the Peoples Praise Him
(Following The Footsteps Of Christ) The Atonement
(Genesis) - Part 15
sermons.description: Melchizedek teaches us that we don't always bless by giving big sermons; two or three appropriate sentences can be all it takes to stir up faith in someone else.  One revelation from God protected Abraham from the temptations from the king of Sodom.  Faith is hearing God's promise to you and "amening" that as Abraham did.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 22
sermons.description: What Abraham gave to Isaac was not a doctrine but a living faith.  The struggle of Jacob and Esau in the womb depicts the struggle in the believer between flesh and spirit.  God's sovereign choice of Jacob was not according to works, which has principles of rest for us, such as being delivered from competition and jealousy over ministry with others in the church.  Isaac's partiality at age 80 is a warning to be steadfast to the spiritual zeal of younger years.

sermons.title: (How to Get Out of a Religious Rut): Three Spiritual Laws
(John 15 #2) Abiding and Fruitfulness
sermons.description: Ed Miller exposes common problems Christians fall into--a growth that is merely external, not internal life that comes from God Himself.  We get off target when we put our eyes on growth.  Brother Ed shows that if you will feed on Christ, you will grow like the lily grows--growing but never concerning itself about its growth.

sermons.title: (John The Baptist Comes To Town) - Part 4 Turn or Burn!
(Missions Conference Shoals) - Part 2
sermons.description: How does a just and holy God forgive sin? For sin is an abomination to the Lord and His very nature demands justice be served. Come and rejoice in a loving Saviour who was willing to drink the cup of God's wrath in our place and be crushed for our transgressions. Learn how only God's perfect Son could satisfy the Father's need for justice. A most powerful and enlightening sermon.

sermons.title: (OM Orientation) Discipline - Part 1
sermons.description: This is a practical look at Disciplining the thought life. He goes on to say that If you sow a thought, you reap an action. If you sow an action you reap a habit. If you sow a habit you reap a lifestyle. If you sow a lifestyle you reap an eternity. This is an excellent message for anyone who is worrisome, anxious and has an undisciplined thought life.

sermons.title: (OM Orientation) Discipline - Part 2
sermons.description: This is a practical look at Disciplining the thought life. He goes on to say that If you sow a thought, you reap an action. If you sow an action you reap a habit. If you sow a habit you reap a lifestyle. If you sow a lifestyle you reap an eternity. This is an excellent message for anyone who is worrisome, anxious and has an undisciplined thought life.

sermons.title: (People God Uses) 02 The Need for Faith
sermons.description: Chuck Smith continues his series on people used by God with focus on faith.  In Hebrews 11:6 we read that without faith it is impossible to please God for he who comes to God must believe that He is and He rewards those that truly seek Him.  The men and women that God uses believe in His promises and stand in faith upon those promises.  Paul reminds us in the Epistle to Romans that it is God who gives us a measure of faith (Romans 12:3).  The men and women that God uses are people of faith.

sermons.title: (Romans) All The World Guilty Before God
(Romans) God's Gateway To Godly Living - Part 1
(Romans) God's Gateway To Godly Living - Part 2
(Romans) God's Gateway To Godly Living - Part 3
(Romans) The Best the Law Could Do
(Romans) The Way to Victory Over Sin
(Secret Of Paulâ€™s Authority) 1. Paul Was A Bondslave
sermons.description: Zac Poonen shares on the powerful subject of the authority of Apostle Paul and his ministry. He shares many truths of how the apostle paul had special authority in his life. This is the first message of seven on this subject. He begins with explaining how Paul realized he was a bondslave of Jesus Christ. The great need in the church today is the authority and presence of God in assembly meetings and persons.

sermons.title: (Spiritual Dangers) Being Under God's Authority
sermons.description: There are many professing Christians who have shipwrecked on the rocks of worldliness because of their unwillingness to submit to God's authority. We have different types of saints: savorless saints (salt-wise), sipping saints (alcohol), and seditious saints (who are likely not saints at all). This message is about the latter, those who cause sedition. God appoints leaders. Insubordination is mutiny against God. Sermon outline: 1. The Danger of Sedition. 2. The Blessing of being under Authority.  3. Proper Servant-Leadership.

sermons.title: (The Better Covenant) 2 - All-Sufficient Grace
sermons.description: "Grace is God's power to help us, to see us through every need we could ever face in our life," Zac Poonen proclaims.  Do you find yourself continually defeated by a sin--anger, lust, dirty thoughts?  You need not live a substandard Christian life but can freely enter into what God has promised of His all-sufficient grace that is more than a match for whatever your need or difficulty is!

sermons.title: (The Glory of God) in Marriage
sermons.description: Brother Paul Washer here lays down the foundation for a biblical and solid marriage. While he tears down the secular mindset that has crept it's way into the church like lists of conditions for a spouse and dating, he also sets up the framework for what can truly help anyones marriage. Many wonderful principles from years of experience are relayed in this sermon, if you are thinking of courtship or marriage, this teaching will greatly benefit the glory of God in that respect.

sermons.title: (The Role Of Demons In Today's Society) Part 3
(basics) 2. God Makes Evil Work For Good
01 Acknowledgements
sermons.description: Every New Testament Epistle is full of acknowledgments1 of believers who were in different cities and those who were laboring hard in the Lord. The names of those who have had a part in this volume are too numerous to mention. To all those who labored in editing, revising, suggesting and offering your counsel we are indebted. Above every human help we recognize the Lordâ€™s hand in this volume from the start to finish. The messages in this book were birthed out of a genuine burden2 of the Lord and we pray this burden has been conveyed with as little interference from the human vessels3 as possible.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 1 Cor 13 (version 1)
sermons.description: This sermon focuses on God's kind of love from the verses written by Paul in 1 Corinthians 13 and Romans 5:5. The majority of the sermon discusses the first half of 1 Cor 13; specifically verses 1 through 8. There are many old hymns and writings quoted by Brother Len that focus on the person and love of God and His Christ intertwined in the message, quite a few from Wesley. There is also some time spent on some of the past saints that exemplified this love.

sermons.title: 1 Cor 13 (version 2)
sermons.description: This sermon focuses on God's kind of love from the verses written by Paul in 1 Corinthians 13 and Romans 5:5. The majority of the sermon discusses the first half of 1 Cor 13; specifically verses 1 through 8. There are many old hymns and writings quoted by Brother Len that focus on the person and love of God and His Christ intertwined in the message, quite a few from Wesley. There is also some time spent on some of the past saints that exemplified this love.

sermons.title: 12. What special act of providence did God exercise towards man in the estate wherein he was created
14 Principle 10 - Preaching the Good News
sermons.description: All Christian service is based on the finished work of Christ.176 The early Apostles did not go around preaching a Gospel of works177 or a message of believers needing to do so much178 to enter heaven but rather all godly living179 was out of appreciation of the mercy of God. â€œTherefore, I urge you, brothers and sisters, in view of Godâ€™s mercy, to offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and pleasing to Godâ€”this is your true and proper worship.â€
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 16 Principle 12 - Jesus Christ The Head of the Church
sermons.description: The Headship of Jesus Christ was not just a doctrine or an idea to the early Apostles but rather a present reality to them. The Lord was the active Head of the Church. They realized it was His Church and everything was done in His Name for Him and through Him.224 This apostolic dependency on the person of Jesus Christ allowed the Lord to be in control of each Assembly. â€œGod placed all things under His feet and appointed Him to be Head over everything for the Church, which is His body, the fullness of Him who fills everything in every way.â€
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 17. Into what estate did the fall bring mankind?
18 Principle 14 - Making Disciples Not Just Converts
sermons.description: Many evangelicals in our day simply believe that to have someone confess Christ with their lips is fulfilling the great commission.257 There are great campaigns to simply have people say a quick prayer and make confession. Though salvation begins with this confession that Jesus Christ is Lord258 yet it is not enough for someone to only be converted, for each convert should be a disciple who follows the Lord daily. â€œThen He said to them all: â€˜Whoever wants to be My disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross daily and follow Me.â€™â€
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 18. Wherein consists the sinfulness of that estate whereinto man fell?
19 Principle 15 - Not Pleasing Men But God Alone
sermons.description: We must always in our walks with Jesus Christ keep our eyes on the Lord and seek to please Him alone. The fact is that we belong to Jesus Christ. He has redeemed us with His precious blood and therefore we are not our own.272 This is a liberating truth if we can realize that all we do is in the clear view of God and therefore seek His approval alone. The early Church walked in the fear of the Lord273 and did not seek the accolades and esteem of men. â€œThen the Church throughout Judea, Galilee and Samaria enjoyed a time of peace and was strengthened. Living in the fear of the Lord and encouraged by the Holy Spirit, it increased in numbers.â€
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 32. What benefits do they that are effectually called partake of in this life?
36. What are the benefits which in this life do accompany or flow from justification, adoption, and
40. What did God at first reveal to man for the rule of his obedience?
47. What is forbidden in the first commandment?
64. What is required in the fifth commandment?
65. What is forbidden in the fifth commandment?
79 Gospel Fellowships Readings (Intro)
sermons.description:
The importance of liturgy in the history of the Christian Church over the 2000 years cannot be underestimated. Some of the earliest hymns in the Church were chants or Scriptural truths read aloud in unison. To verbally proclaim in unison holy truths of God will have a great affect spiritually on the Assembly of believers to strengthen and unify them in the faith once delivered to the saints.1148
We are commended in the Scriptures to verbally proclaim our allegiance to the Son of God, confessing truths that we believe in our heart.1149 Though modern day evangelicalism is mostly non-liturgical this was not so in the early days of Christianity.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 80. What is required in the tenth commandment?
A Baptism of Tears for Israel
sermons.description: Michael Brown delivers a piercing and burdening message calling the body of Christ to take the eternal reality of the unsaved seriously and allow God to grieve us for the salvation of the lost. By emphasizing Paul’s burden and heart wrenching desire for Israel, Dr. Brown shares both the closeness and hardness of Israel and reveals the need for a broken heart over all men.

sermons.title: A Building
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson discusses the resurrection, and how the way we live our lives each day is having a direct impact on the type of body we will receive when we are raised on that day. He discusses the reasons why God has started us out in this body, and the purpose of the new body we will receive. (1 hour 18 minutes).

sermons.title: A Living Sacrifice - Part 1
sermons.description: This message starts with a brief summary of what Mr Washer preached earlier in the week. Then, after exhorting fathers in the fulfilling of their Biblical responsibilities, he turns to Romans 12:1-2 where the apostle Paul urges us to give our lives away; not for a cause, but to a Person. Our motivation for doing so is ‘the mercies of God’, which Mr Washer then explains. This laying down of one’s life is a once-and-for-all decision; but why does Paul say, Present your bodies? For one thing, it destroys the notion that a man can outwardly live in ungodliness whilst claiming that in his heart he really loves Jesus Christ. Furthermore, the things we do in our bodies are evidence of our sanctification and dedication to God. Mr Washer also examines in some detail what we put in to our bodies, revealing our responsibilities before God and men. He then considers in turn our eyes, ears, tongue, hands and feet, and how we clothe our bodies; he pleads with us to do all things to the glory of God.  (46 minutes).

sermons.title: A Living Sacrifice - Part 2
sermons.description: Part 2 opens with one more example of presenting our bodies a living sacrifice: the dangers of dating. This is so rarely taught that something has to be said from a Biblical basis. Parents are not teaching their children their responsibilities, and the church is not showing the parents how. Biblical counsel is this: don’t put yourself in the way of temptation. This issue is not a question of the intellect, it’s a question of the will: we know what’s right, we just don’t want to do it. Proceeding into v.2,  Mr Washer explains what it means to be not conformed to this world, both for individuals and for the church. He explains that the renewing of the mind is a total transformation, a supernatural creative work of God. He then examines the will of God, and how you will know it by its characteristics of being good, acceptable and perfect. This message outlines practical issues that we all have to deal with. Believing the doctrine is one thing; but is it a growing, practical reality in your life? If not, stop and deal with it, one step at a time.  (43 minutes)

sermons.title: A Plea For Moral Purity
sermons.description: Carter Carter gives a solemn but very practical and heart-felt message on this needful subject. A pleasure measure society needs a pure church to give them a message of hope. We cannot have impurity and not suffer consequences and a lack of fruitfulness in our walks with Jesus Christ. This message is a clear warning from the heart of God.

sermons.title: A Proper Orientation
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson asserts that the goal of Christianity is not a change in location, but a change in what we are. He endeavors to get us to shift our focus off of Heaven as the goal, and onto being transformed into the image of Jesus Christ, and being reunited with the Father. Please bring your thinking cap for this one. (1 hour 18 minutes).

sermons.title: A Reprobate Mind
sermons.description: Preached Saturday, May 27, 2006, at the Fredericton Farmer's Market. No box, no music... this message caused the most people to stop and listen than I have ever seen yet. It seemed the entire section of the market was attentively listening to God's Word being proclaimed. "And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient." (Romans 1:28)

sermons.title: A Service of Sorrow (World Trade Center Response)
A Spirit of Apathy
sermons.description:
Pastor Legge begins with some very sobering stories about the apathy that is rampant in the world today and also sadly in the hearts of those that are His church. The spirit of apathy could, according to a leading scholar, be the very thing that brings our society and that the epitaph of our society will be "This society died because it just couldn't be bothered". This spirit is seeping into the church and we see the contrast between it and that man of God the Apostle Paul. He shows how we will not be able to win souls until we have wept for souls and our own apathy has been nailed to the Cross.

sermons.title: A Spirit of Slumber
sermons.description: A sobering message for those who are not diligent in prayer and neglect reading the Word. This is a wake up call.

sermons.title: A YES TO YOUR CROSS
sermons.description: God lives and works today! He can live and work in your life today - if you let Him! But that means you have to give Him something - a "Yes!" Today's meditation, by Basilea Schlink will share about the "Yes" that makes you free!

sermons.title: A YES TO YOUR CROSS
sermons.description: God  can live and work in your life today - if you let Him!  But that means you have to give Him something - a “Yes!” This meditation will share about the “Yes” that makes you free!

sermons.title: A body for the Holy Spirit
sermons.description: Erlo Stegen exhorts us to live a life worthy of the gospel of Jesus christ. He specifically shows how God commands us to present our actual bodies on this earth to God for His service. So that the good and acceptable and perfect will of God can be completed in our life.

sermons.title: AND HAVE NOT LOVE
sermons.description: God is almighty and all-powerful - and the source of His power is His great love. The same holds true for us! This meditation  shares the true story of how one man made this exciting and earnest discovery!

sermons.title: AT ONE WITH THE WILL OF GOD
sermons.description: There is nothing more wonderful in life than to experience God’s reality from day to day.   For then suffering loses its power over us, and prayers are answered.

sermons.title: AT ONE WITH THE WILL OF GOD
sermons.description: There is nothing more wonderful in life than to experience God’s reality from day to day, and to be united with Him in love. For then suffering loses its power over us, and prayers are answered.

sermons.title: Adopted
sermons.description: Bro. Wilkerson explains how you become a part of the family of God when you are born again and all the rights and inheritance you obtain as a child of God. He contrasts the vast difference in the inheritance the devil's family has waiting and the Lord's family.  God's people desperately need to know of a surety their position in Christ. This will defeat much of the work of the enemy in trying to hinder your walk with God. A must hear for every Christian.

sermons.title: All Israel Shall Be Saved
sermons.description: This message is a passionate call to intercede for Israel with a persuasive explanation of their place in scripture, the end times and in God’s heart. Dr. Brown clearly denies replacement theology, but not with theological arguments but with a scriptural revelation of God’s relationship with His chosen people and His heart for those who are so close and yet so far from His grace.

sermons.title: An Unchanging Scandalous Gospel
sermons.description: Recorded at the HBC Missions Conference 2008. After introductory exhortations to up-coming preachers and evangelists, Paul Washer sets out to highlight some of the errors destroying modern-day evangelism. He also explains what should be preached, and how, and likens labouring with souls to the travails of birth. We must understand that the gospel is unbelievable, and is scandalous; if we remove the scandal, we remove the power. This world is ripe for a move of God: What a time to be alive!!, he exclaims (67 minutes).

sermons.title: And We Know-Rm.8:28 A Soft Pillow For A Tired Heart
Are You Safe?
sermons.description: Hywel R. Jones shares clearly from the Scriptures that we are not safe from God in our sins and apart from God. God is to be feared because He must judge sin and damn to hell. But oh the wonderful truth to be safe from God in Jesus Christ and also to be safe "in" God in "His" love. Preaching in an evangelical wales conference in 1985.

sermons.title: Awake And Be Ready
sermons.description: Stephen talks about the need for us to be awake, to repent, and to return to Christ.

sermons.title: Barriers Broken Down
sermons.description: You that have your Bibles open, kindly follow me from the first verse of the chapter. It begins, 'Brethren, my heart's desire and prayer to God for Israel is, that they might be saved.' If you really desire that men should be saved, pray for them. It is an empty wish, a mere formality, if you do not turn it into prayer. Every loving desire for any man or woman should, by the believer, be taken before God in prayer. We cannot expect that God will save men unless his people pray for it. There must be travail before the birth, and there must be travail in prayer with God before we can expect that many will be born again into the church of God. Oh, for more prayer! Let us cry to God in secret, and in the family, and in all our assemblies, that God would save the sons of men. But prayer, if it is sincere, is always attended with effort. Hence the apostle begins to teach as well as to pray. He prays that Israel might be saved, and then he explains the difficulties in the way, and tries to remove them. You pray, dear friend, do you? But you never speak to the individual for whom you pray. Is your prayer sincere? I will not question it. But...

sermons.title: Be Not Conformed To The World
Be a Man (At Home and At Church)
sermons.description: All men, even Christians, are so influenced by the culture we live in, that we say and do many things that are not Biblical, without even realising it. Paul Washer begins his exhortations by dealing with the speculations (AV = ‘imaginations’) which must be cast down if we are to fulfil our calling to be a biblical people. He focuses on the roles of men in particular, both in their families and their local churches, which he shows to be the two hardest places to live out a Biblical manhood. Most problems in those two areas, he says, can be traced back to men not standing on truth and not acting Biblically. Working through specific examples, he shows how the speculations of men actually fight against God, and also shows how such things should be put right. He then focuses in some detail on marriage, using Romans 8:28. Once a man discovers the true purpose of marriage, and learns what it means to love his wife as Christ loves the church, he will find both joy and rest in putting an end to his former speculations about the nature of marriage.  (52 minutes)

sermons.title: Bearing a True Witness of God
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson makes the case that the New Covenant is primarily a covenant of transformation, rather than the popular opinion that it is primarily a covenant of forgiveness. He discusses the differences and similarities between the old and new covenants. He discusses the difference between preaching and witnessing. He talks about how Jesus doesn’t judge us based upon what we believe, but rather based upon what we do and how we live each day. We witness by what we are and how we live, not by what we say. The second half of this sermon is very strong. (53 minutes 54 seconds)

sermons.title: Being Filled with the Holy Spirit - Part 1
sermons.description: This passage in Romans is often misinterpretted by many in the church today, to mean that to recieved the gift of the Spirit is the same as being filled with the Spirit, which it is not.  Pastor Maxwell shows how in many cases in the scriptures the filling of the Holy Spirit was subsequent to the recieving of the Spirit.  He shows that the prescence of the Spirit is not the smae as the presiding of the Spirit, this is how the Holy Spirit can be present in us but we are not allowing Him to rule over over us.

sermons.title: Being Filled with the Holy Spirit Part 2
sermons.description: Why do we want to be filled with Holy Spirit?  To be filled with Spirit will not bring us fame, prosperity, the love and admiration of our fellow man.  It will most likely bring division, reproach and persecution.  So is the example shown in the scriptures both old and new testaments, in the cases of Elijah in the cave, Jonah under the gourd, Paul in prison, John the Baptists beheading, Steven's stoning and of course the Lord Jesus' crucifxion. We are filled with the Holy Spirit for God's purposes and His alone.

sermons.title: Being Led by the Spirit
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson starts by defining “The Law of the Spirit of Life.” He talks about what the Holy Spirit is, and how the Holy Spirit gets confused with other spirits and feelings and gifts. He describes what can be done to foster spiritual maturity, so that we learn to tell when the Holy Spirit is active in our midst. He discusses very practical ways we can live by the Spirit. He says God will not have people who are not under law – the Holy Spirit is our Law. We are either under the Law of Moses or under the Law of the Spirit. (55 minutes, 58 seconds)

sermons.title: Being What You Are - Romans 6 and Regeneration
sermons.description: Most Christians think the Christian life is struggling to be something you’re not, when in fact it’s being what you already are: that is, a new creature in Christ. So says Paul Washer as he expounds the realities of regeneration, and what it means to be crucified with Christ, dead to sin, and alive unto God. With customary passion he contrasts the natures of people before and after conversion, and shows how the truths of Romans 6 empower believers to live according to Romans 12  (55 minutes).

sermons.title: Boiling for Christ
sermons.description: The highest privilege in the world is to serve Jesus Christ, but our service can be misguided if we serve our own appetites, people, or the law.  "All of our serving," says John Piper, "is receiving service from Christ which He bought for us when He died."  In other words, serving Jesus is first trusting Jesus to serve me.

sermons.title: Building Up My Brother's House
sermons.description: (preached: Dec. 12, 2002)

sermons.title: CMML Missions Conference 1993-02 Committment To Christ
Can I Be Righteous Before God?
Change
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson begins by equating the Kingdom of God with “change.” He says that the Kingdom is not primarily a "place" but rather it is a transformation in what you are, inside and out. He discusses the parable of the sower, and the different types of ground. He covers very practical ways to tell how you are doing in Christ today. He ties the parable of the sower in with the fruit of the spirit. A very entertaining, informative and practical sermon.

sermons.title: Changed Into Christ's Image #6
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson begins by discussing the fact that Jesus lives in the fire of God’s presence, and that if we are to be with Jesus where He is (John 14:3), we must be ready to live with Him in that Fire. Once we have been prepared to dwell in that fire, and for that fire to dwell in us, we can then go out and minister to lost mankind, bringing that fire and that life to people – it will flow out of us and bring life and light. Dr. Thompson says that is our eternal purpose in Christ – to be priests of God in His Kingdom forever. He discusses the unique unity that Adam and Eve shared, and the similarities with the unity that Christ and the Church are to have. This sermon will challenge you to look at your relationship with God in whole new ways (that sounds cliché, but it is very true in this case).

sermons.title: Changed Into Christ's Image #7
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson says that Romans 8:1 is conditional – that we are without condemnation IF we are not living after the sinful nature, but after the Spirit. He says there are only two ways to live, two ways that you can approach any decision or action – either in the flesh or in the spirit. If you don’t live after the Spirit, you are still under condemnation. He discusses the difference between “the pursuit of happiness” and “the pursuit of righteousness.” He says the key to "living in the Spirit" can be found in Proverbs 3:5-6, “In all your ways acknowledge Him…” Dr. Thompson finishes by discussing some "big picture" elements, such as, why God created man as a response to the rebellion of the angels. Excellent sermon, very practical.

sermons.title: Chapel of the Air - Interview with Dr. Orr (part 2)
sermons.description: Habakkuk 2:2, 2 Chronicles 7:14. Dr. Orr discusses how he believed that Satan was the main hindrance to people understanding revival, and though he was a revival scholar, his intent was not to increase knowledge on the subject for the sake of increasing knowledge, but rather to increase knowledge of revival to enable people to be subjects of revival. He also talks about areas of the world where he believed revival was currently happening, along with some of the mistakes that people have made after revival has occurred.  "I shudder to hear of people who claim to be filled with the Holy Spirit without any holiness of life." Dr. Orr talks about how after years of revival work he kept himself renewed. "Evan Roberts once said to me 'always pray for a vision to match your faith'."

sermons.title: Character Matters
sermons.description: Brother Glenn speaks a very powerful message on character in the Christian life. He speaks of revival and the need for repentance and genuine christian living to see a movement of God in our day. If we are living in hypocrisy and self-righteousness we will not see a move of God.

sermons.title: Cherishing the Treasure of Christ
sermons.description: We have this treasure in earthen vessels; the Spirit of the living God indwelling believers. And that presence will produce in a hungry soul an ever increasing revelation of who Christ is. This is often revealed in us and to us through suffering and trials. We have this great kingdom which cannot be moved, such great victory, and power living in us. Pastor Conlon goes through many other scriptures revealing how the Lord Jesus Christ is our Treasure. The person drawing closer to Him, cannot help being awed by Him, and at the same time painfully aware of their own sinful flesh in comparison. If your heart is toward Christ he knows, and he will not let the enemy overwhelm you as you trust in him. Pursuit of an ever increasing knowledge and intimacy with Christ should be the Christian's number one priority. When we get careless with the word of God and prayer, tragedy can come. The devil is always after the treasure of the presence of Christ in your life. Pastor Conlon warns: There is no greater danger than to become careless with this Book!

sermons.title: Christ Made Perfect
sermons.description: Major Thomas ask the question, “What saves us, Christ’s death or life?” Very understandable explanations of salvation, justification, sanctification and reconciliation . We are trying to show the world what the church can do for Christ…instead of what Christ can do through the church.

sermons.title: Christ Our Sanctification #1
sermons.description: Ed Miller traverses the familiar ground of Romans 6 and 7 to illustrate Christian liberty from the old self, the old master (sin) and the old husband (the law).  "What's true of Jesus," says brother Ed, "is true as your Substitute."  How do we enter in and obtain the finished work of Jesus?  Listen to this series and see Jesus as your complete Savior!

sermons.title: Christ Our Sanctification #3
sermons.description: "The closest relationship you've ever had with Jesus," shares Ed Miller, "is only a handful of corn compared to what's coming."  Creation, the Christian, and the Spirit all groan in sympathy with what God's future plan that brings comfort and assurance of true holiness today.  Holiness does not come by studying holiness but entering into the substitution of the Savior.

sermons.title: Christ Our Sanctification #4
sermons.description: "Every moment of every day," assures Ed Miller, "is crowding you to Christ.  Life is your school."  When we can rest assured that God's providence is working our conformity to Christ, when we can see Christ Himself as our sanctification (holiness), we'll get our eyes off sin and holiness and be holy in reality.

sermons.title: Christ Overcame Evil With Good, Do the Same
Christ in Genesis #1: Adam's Tree
sermons.description: Why did God make a tree of life when Adam already had life?  What does it mean to live by life or by knowledge?  Stephen Kaung answers these questions as he shows from the first book of the Bible that the divine life of God is only in Christ.  This message is the first of 8 messages, each corresponding to the 8 biographies portrayed in Genesis, which all put together picture Christ, the Man after God's own heart.

sermons.title: Christ the Man #2
sermons.description: This teaching shows us that we have the power to keep from being conformed to this world.  We can be transformed to be like Christ.  He too was tempted as a man but overcame—we have the same power within us through Christ.

sermons.title: Christians are dying, no longer seeing or hearing Christ
sermons.description: We were discussing Romans 8 this morning, and in Romans 8 he says, â€œWe are savedâ€¦â€  Thatâ€™s the song that we sing everywhere: â€œWe are saved,â€  â€œWeâ€™re saved.â€  When I first came here, a SchwÃ¤bish brother was telling about years ago, and he says, â€œI war no net gâ€™saved jena Zeit.â€  Jetzt ischdâ€™r gâ€™saved.  Bisch du au gâ€™saved?  We are saved. But the Bible says, â€œWe are saved by hope.â€   And thatâ€™s the thing that gives me great joy: to know that the work we do here, we donâ€™t do for a few years only, or for some gloryâ€”for some crown upon this earth, or recommendation by men.  Weâ€™re notâ€¦ weâ€™re not geared to Brooklyn, or to this time, but weâ€™re geared to eternity, to heaven, to the New Jerusalem.  Thatâ€™s the thing we have been working for, praise God!  And 32 years is really a very, very short time when you think that the seed we sow is going to result in a harvest thatâ€™s going to go on forever and forever to the glory of God.  And how very, very important it is that we get the sight of itâ€”that we get the light of it.

sermons.title: Christmas Preparations
sermons.description: With the recent world events, Pastor Cymbala teaches about what we need to do to prepare for this Christmas. Romans 12:9-10, 14, 15-16, 18 (NIV)

sermons.title: Christmas Talk
sermons.description: I wonder what they had to tell when they got to heaven.  I wonder what they had to tell, because there were other angels up there waiting and wondering what in the world happened when Jesus Christ the Son of God came among men.  What happened?  Oh, I think there must have been real sadness in heaven.  â€œWhy, they were all asleepâ€”the whole city of the King.  They were all asleep.  We couldnâ€™t even wake them up with our trumpets.  We had to go out into the field where the shepherds were watching.  They were awake.  They were awakeâ€”they heard us.â€ I heard an Alliance preacher say that angels donâ€™t sing.  I donâ€™t know.  All our songs talk about angels singing.  But the Bible doesnâ€™t say that.  They talked; they had a messageâ€”a very wonderful message, but nobody there to listen to it, nobody there to be interested.  â€œHe came unto His ownâ€¦â€â€”what a fact; how very wonderful: this entire Old Testament was a preparation for the coming of the King to this earth, and was intended to prepare hearts to be ready to receive Him.  But when He came, there was â€œno form nor comliness that we should desire Him.â€  My goodness, who in the world would have looked for Him in a mangerâ€”in a manager in a stable?

sermons.title: Church History - Martin Luther & the Problem of Indulgences
sermons.description: Martin Luther was born in Germany to a poor mining family, Luther though excelled at school and studied law at university, he was set to be one of the top legal minds in Europe.  However due to a vow to Saint Barbara, patron saint of miners, he became a monk and applied his legal mind to theology, he saw the Lord as righteous Judge of the whole creation and thus was zealous to live a holy life.  In 1510 he went to Rome, as he was disillusioned with the way the church was in Germany, there he became even more concerned and left declaring that the city was built over Hell itself! He returned to Germany where he became a Bible teacher it was here in preparing for a lesson one day that he read Psalm 31:1 and later Romans 1:17 and realised by faith man can not only be deemed 'not guilty' but actually be seen as righteous before a perfect God.

sermons.title: Constant, Instant, Expectant
sermons.description: DELIVERED ON LORD'S-DAY MORNING, JUNE 22ND, 1879, BY C. H. SPURGEON, AT THE METROPOLITAN TABERNACLE, NEWINGTON. “Continuing instant in prayer.” - Romans 12:12. THIS is placed in connection with a large number of brief but very weighty precepts. Prayer has a distinct relationship to all Christian duties and graces. It is not possible for us to carry out the holy commands of our Lord Jesus unless we are abundant in supplication. The Romans at the time that Paul wrote to them were subject to persecution, and in this verse he mentions two remedies for impatience under such afflictions, remedies which are equally effectual under all the trials of life. The old physicians tell us of two antidotes against poison, the hot and the cold, and they dilate upon the special excellence of each of these: in like manner the apostle Paul gives us first the warm antidote - “Rejoicing in hope,” and then he gives us the cool antidote, “Patient in tribulation.” Either of these, or both together, will work wonderfully for the sustaining of the spirit in the hour of affliction; but it is to be observed, that neither of these remedies can be taken into the soul except they be mixed with a draught of prayer. Joy and patience are curative essences, but they must be dropped into a glass full of supplication, and then they will be wonderfully efficient. How can we “rejoice in hope” if we know nothing about prayer to the God of hope.

sermons.title: Continue In Sin
sermons.description: Why do believers continue in sin?  Year after year after year they continue in some sort of sin and they never come into the fullness of the Covenant blessing of God.  Often times it may well just be one area that remains but nonetheless folks continue in that sin.  Wilkerson preaches a very personal message here and he shares his heart and shows his own weakness as an example.  The consequences for a Christian continuing in sin are sobering, but he gave us what we needed to overcome sin, if we want to. For those who are sick of their sin, and hate it, and cry out to God, there is wonderful news. He will empower you, and he wants to put his fear in your heart so you will not turn away from him, and then he can take you into the fullness of the new covenant. Powerful preaching, with a gentle compassion for those who are struggling.

sermons.title: Conviction and Condemnation - Part 1
sermons.description: Dr. Brown examines the true definition of condemnation, its effects and the emotions that accuse us. He offers powerful wisdom as to how to anchor oneself in the truth and in the grace and person of Jesus.

sermons.title: Conviction and Condemnation - Part 2
sermons.description: The second part of this message gives a strong call to holiness, expositing the scriptures, dismissing all excuses and encouraging all to cling to Jesus in the conviction of the Holy Spirit. The first part of the message explained condemnation, which allows Dr. Brown to make strong statements in the second half within the context of grace.

sermons.title: Cry of the Unreached
sermons.description: If Hell is not real then God and the Bible are not either. If Hell is eternal so is heaven and those who do not know Jesus Christ will spend their eternity in hell. They will be tortured for all of eternity but they will never die. Does this bother us? As believers what are we doing to help those who do not know the good news of Christ?

sermons.title: DEATH OF LIFE IN THE EMOTIONS (ROMANS 5:17b)
sermons.description: As a result of the original sin and the fall of man, our emotions have been affected: we no longer have the approval of God, so we seek out that emotional approval from other people. But through Jesus' death on the cross, resurrection and the giving of the Holy Spirit, we can have peace with God and our emotions can become balanced.

sermons.title: Death Of Life In The Mind
sermons.description: When man fell in the garden of Eden, it caused the breakdown ofthe mind. But through a relationship with Jesus and through the Holy Spirit, we can regain control of our minds and have peace and good mental health.

sermons.title: Deliverance and Power
sermons.description: The Word tells us how we are to deal with three problems: guilt, temptation, and the need of power.

sermons.title: Destroying Pop-Christian Views of Marital Bliss - Part 1
sermons.description: This is not your typical wedding sermon that is forgotten as soon as it is preached... it is full of practical, biblical and powerful advice about marriage and God's purpose for it. This sermon is not just for those seeking marriage or those recently married, it will even benefit those who have been married for decades.

sermons.title: Do Not Avenge Yourselves, But Give Place to Wrath
Do Not Destroy the Work of God
Don't Break God's Heart
sermons.description: What a tradegy that many of God's people are missing their birthright, inheritance and what Christ secured on us for the cross. Forgiveness of sins is just like cleaning the cup but there is much more purpose and fulness in God that we need to seek after. Is the Devil robbing our inheritance in Christ? This breaks God's heart in our day.

sermons.title: Each One Should Be Fully Convinced in His Own Mind
Evolution or Creation
sermons.description: In the debate between creation vs. evolution, the fundamental nail in evolution theories coffin is the field of study known as information science.  All existing life exists as a result of information, organized information.  Statistical analysts understand that information does not arise by chance.  AE Wilder-Smith shows in this discussion how to understand information theory, and how it proves creationism to be the only logical viewpoint.  Matter is not self-organizing; it is merely a medium for information.   Smith discusses the classic debate between Bishop Wilberforce and Aldous Huxley concerning the watch-maker.  He shows the fallacy of Huxley’s argument.  If you are not familiar with this debate it is a rather essential understanding in order to unravel the Gordian-Knot of evolution theory.  Smith argues in this teaching how important creationism understandings are because man is accountable to God upon the basis of God being revealed through nature.

sermons.title: FIRE AND COALS
sermons.description: To be filled with love for God means to be filled with an invincible power and joy. How can we acquire such a love for Him and how can we keep this love burning in our hearts? Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Faith In The Risen Christ
sermons.description: Alan shares a powerful word on the significance and reason for the resurrection of Christ. This is a challenging word and really shows from scriptures some of the inconsistencies of evangelical belief in just the death of Christ but no emphasis on the resurrection.

sermons.title: Faith To Leave The Gas Station
sermons.description: We are reminded here that we can have all the Biblical knowledge possible, yet still be empty.  You must have a personal relationship with Jesus to go out and serve Him. He uses a lot of Scripture confirming this and also shares how one can find such a relationship with Christ.

sermons.title: Faith unto Enlargement through Adversity - Part 3
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 04/01/1954.

sermons.title: Faith unto Enlargement through Adversity - Part 4
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 04/01/1954.

sermons.title: Faith unto Enlargement through Adversity - Part 8
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 04/01/1954.

sermons.title: Falling Stars - A Message for Preachers
sermons.description: Erlo Stegen speaks a powerful word on failure in preachers and calling ministers to be lights in the evil dark world. Why is it so dark in the world? Because many stars have fallen, the preachers of the Gospel have fallen. Ministers and preachers are being caught in evil things. It is getting dark in the world. It seems as if the sun is indeed going down. It seems as if weâ€™re coming to the end of the world and the end of time. We read that in the last days it will indeed go difficult, and that the powers of heaven will be shaken (Matt 24:29).

sermons.title: First Love: A Sign Of Sonship
sermons.description: "We cannot come to a realization of sonship," says Dana Congdon, "unless the foundation of His salvation is firmly established in us."  Dana walks through the progressive revelation of the love of God through the book of Romans that leads us past "being saved to serve" to see our sonship in wholehearted devotion to Jesus Christ.

sermons.title: Fit or Misfit? (part 4): Examples of the motivational gifts
Follow The Leader
sermons.description: For Christians, the same Spirit that raised Jesus from the dead lives in us. In this teaching, Pastor Cymbala urges listeners to live a Spirit led life. Rom 8:3-8 (GNB)

sermons.title: For Whom is the Gospel Meant?
sermons.description: “They that are whole have no need of the physician, but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.” -Mark 2:17. “Christ died for the ungodly.”-Romans 5:6. “God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.”-Romans 5:8. “This is a faithful saying, and worthy of all acceptation, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners.”-1 Timothy 1:15. Out of a very great number I have selected the four texts which I have read just to set forth the truth that the mission of our Lord related to sinners. What did Christ come into the world for? For whom did he come? These are questions of the greatest importance, and they are clearly answered in Scripture.

sermons.title: From Suffering to Glory
sermons.description: When Paul was converted on the way to Damascus, God told Ananias that He would show Paul how much he was still to suffer for the name of Jesus. The sermon preached to Paul wasn't like so many of today's sermons, where people are told that they should come to Jesus to be happy, joyful, blessed, rich etc. That's why so many fall away. Of course those things could be added but that's not the reason you come to God neither the reason God saves you. God saves you that you might know Him and do His will, wherever He might lead. Someone asked one of the co-workers why he wasn't preaching a Gospel of love, blessedness and material prosperity. He answered that we preach the love of God as revealed in His Son Jesus who suffered and died for us on the cross because of our sin. He died so that we can be saved, do His will and lay down our lives for our fellowmen so that they too can be saved. The man then broke down and answered that he realizes for the first time that he has never been saved, but only followed after other men.

sermons.title: Fulfilling the Mystery of Israel - Part 1
sermons.description: Drawing from Romans chapter 11, Art shows that the Jew has not been cast away, and that there is a divine purpose in the necessary but temporary setting aside of this people.

sermons.title: Fulfilling the Mystery of Israel - Part 2
sermons.description: Drawing from Romans chapter 11, Art shows that the Jew has not been cast away, and that there is a divine purpose in the necessary but temporary setting aside of this people.

sermons.title: GRACE WILL TRIUMPH
sermons.description: God lives and works today! You too should be able to experience this, even if there are many unanswered questions in your life, and many things that you don’t understand. The following meditation by Basilea Schlink has an answer from the Word of God which can make you happy and free. Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Gentiles Rejoice in the Root of Jesse
Gifts In The Body Of Christ ~ Romans 12
God At War With Flesh
sermons.description: Major Thomas uses quite a few Scripture to lead us to the realization that we have power over our flesh through Christ.   He wonderfully illustrates this with Moses and the “smitten rock” and Esau as being he devil incarnate.

sermons.title: God Calls Things That Are Not As Though Were
God Helps Those Who Cannot Help Themselves
God Vindicated His Righteousness
sermons.description: John Piper delivers a powerful sermon painting the picture of the two mindsets that people hold. The mindset of the world and the mindset of the bible. This sermon clearly potray's the cross of Jesus Christ as a objective reality and truth and how the gospel does not center on man's needs, expectations, desires and rights but rather the cross promotes the glory of the only God.

sermons.title: God wants the total you
sermons.description: God has mercy on us each and every day. Whether you're a Christian or not, you are here by the grace of God. It is only His mercy that you are still alive. In Acts 5 we read of Ananias and Sapphira who died when they lied to the Holy Spirit. In 1Cor 10:8-11 Paul relates how the children of Israel were judged and killed when they committed fornication, murmured and tempted Christ. And these things happened to them as examples to us, so that we would be admonished not to do the same. If we therefore think of ourselves, the fact that we are still alive is only because of His mercy. God is gracious to you but if you carry on in sin you will be destroyed.

sermons.title: God's Law In The Godly Life
God's Purpose For The Jewish People
sermons.description: Michael Brown shares how God is not finished with the Jewish people that the Christian believe is not separate but connected to jewish believers from the past and that God is still going to save the jewish people in the end times. He quotes many scriptures and gives many testimonies of this being true in life.

sermons.title: God's Sovereignty in the Salvation of Men
sermons.description: God is Sovereign in all aspects of life, but especially over the eternal souls of human beings. Romans 9:18

sermons.title: Gods Love
sermons.description: Through personal experiences and provoking stories, Corrie expounds on the power of God's love as given to believers through His Holy Spirit. In testimony to His faithfulness, she tells of how His love, working in her, freed her from hatred and unforgiveness towards one of the cruelest empires.

sermons.title: God’s Wrath: Vengeance Is Mine, I Will Repay, Says the Lord
Grace For Living
sermons.description: Thereâ€™s so much talk about grace, but why grace?  What is the purpose of grace?  Some think it is for freedom, some think it is to do away with the law, and others think itâ€™s so they can do whatever they feel like.  But not so, Grace is for living!

sermons.title: Growing in the Grace of God #19 - New Covenant Obedience Part 1
Growing in the Grace of God #20 - New Covenant Obedience Part 2
He Drank Your Hell
sermons.description: Using the scripture passage above, supported by a wide selection of other Bible verses, Paul Washer gives a powerful exposition of the cross of Christ. He explains our sin, God’s justice, and how sinners can be justified. He reveals what was in the cup that Christ drank, and why God forsook him on the cross. Do you want to know how much God hates sin? Mr Washer asks; then look what God did to his own beloved Son. (74 minutes).

sermons.title: Hell's Best Kept Secret (French)
sermons.description: Have you discovered "Hell's Best Kept Secret?" One pastor listened to it 250 times. Pastor Bob Rogers said, "I have served as a local pastor, Teen Challenge Director, Crusade Director for David Wilkerson, and missionary, but never during those years did I encounter an evangelist with a more life-changing message." It's been called "the hottest message on the planet!" (this is not about "Hell") What are you waiting for... Why do 80-90% of those making a decision for Christ fall away from the faith? What is the principle that Spurgeon, Wesley, Whitefield, etc., used to reach the lost? Why has the Church neglected it? Don't let anything stop you from listening to this incredible teaching.
