sermons.title: Hindrances to Prevailing Prayer
sermons.description: There are many reasons Christians do not pray as they should, and this is one of the gentlest rebukes Pastor Wilkerson has given on this subject. He lovingly explains about the warfare we have to fight our way through to pray, and reveals even if we have neglected to pray as we should, God still wants us to come to him, and he will by the Holy Ghost teach us how to pray as we should. For that alone is how we learn. So stop beating yourself up and get alone with the Holy Spirit and ask him to teach you to pray.

sermons.title: Holy Spirit and The Crisis of Pentecost - Part 1
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 05/01/1959.

sermons.title: Holy Spirit and The Crisis of Pentecost - Part 2
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 05/01/1959.

sermons.title: Hope
sermons.description: This one is a gem! Parkyns revives the power of HOPE, a word seen frequently in scripture.  Hope can strengthen a wavering faith. Hope is the path to healing. When combined with love, hope can restore the one near death. Hope keeps us from sinking into despair. Hope keeps us looking forward to a righteousness that we can never experience until the next life.

sermons.title: How Satan Destroys a Church - Part 2 (HOW SATAN DESTROYS BY DIVIDING)
sermons.description: Satan seeks to destroy the church by dividing us from God and each other.  Rebellion against authority by anyone can bring destruction.  In the home the husband can lose his leadership by not loving his wife as instructed in Ephesians 5 and his wife will greatly suffer by his lack of love and the end result will be division in the home.

sermons.title: How to Welcome a Weak Brother
Humanizing God
sermons.description: Lou Sutera is honest with the hearers sharing how desperately wicked society has become around us. His main point is showing how little esteemed God is and how society and sadly Christians have "humanized God" to make Him as we are. Revival is utmost and necessary to see God as He truly is! This message is a clarion call for the need and urgency we should have.

sermons.title: Humanizing God by Lou Sutera
sermons.description: Lou Sutera is honest with the hearers sharing how desperately wicked society has become around us. His main point is showing how little esteemed God is and how society and sadly Christians have "humanized God" to make Him as we are. Revival is utmost and necessary to see God as He truly is! This message is a clarion call for the need and urgency we should have.

sermons.title: IN THE MIDST OF SUFFERING
sermons.description: Perhaps you could testify to His reality when you think about especially happy times in your life. But what about the times of affliction, when the waves of trouble rise up and almost seem to drown you? Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: If heaven is yours
sermons.description: A person who is asleep doesn't know what is going on around him. So too those who are asleep spiritually. Salvation has come, but they are asleep and oblivious to the fact. They insist on following their own ambitions. Their life just revolves around themselves. They are dead in their sins. But if the Lord has quickened you, your life should overflow. Spiritually you should live a supernatural, victorious life. God expects it from you and me. In Hebrews 2, Jesus says that He isn't ashamed to call us His brethren. (We say it with utter respect and only because Jesus said it first). We are even called heirs to His Kingdom. As an heir you stand in line for an inheritance. Our life must be different if we truly comprehend this fact. Woe to you if you don't wake up, do His will and live the life He expects from you.

sermons.title: Jonah-The Man, The Message, The Movement
Joshua’s Divine Commission
sermons.description: God called Joshua to lead Israel into the promised Land, to fulfill His promise of giving the Land to Abraham's descendants.  Just as He called Joshua,  if you are a child of God,  the Lord is calling you to a specific work as well.  Join us now as Pastor Brent teaches us about Joshua's Divine Commission.

sermons.title: Joy in God
sermons.description: I am going to answer three questions. First, what is joy in God? Secondly, how is this the evidence of reconciliation? “We joy in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom we have now received the reconciliation.” And, thirdly, why is it that this joy is said to be through our Lord Jesus Christ?

sermons.title: Joy out of Travail
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 11/01/1958.

sermons.title: K-086 The Mystery of Israel and the Church
K-508 The Children of Promise (1 of 2)
sermons.description: Speaking from the early verses of Romans 9, Art gives an insight into God’s choice of Israel and His promises towards her.  A 1995 message.

sermons.title: K-509 The Children of Promise (2 of 2)
sermons.description: Speaking from the early verses of Romans 9, Art gives an insight into God’s choice of Israel and His promises towards her.  A 1995 message.

sermons.title: Kirk Cameron Testimony
sermons.description: Kirk Cameron shares a bit of personal testimony of how he came to know the Lord Jesus Christ, and then shared the burden of his heart, appealing to his audience to examine whether they be a true believer or not.  Ray Comfort teaches a good bit of the time the priceless principles of biblical evangelism--the need for the law to expose sin and its preparation for the heart for the grace of the gospel.

sermons.title: Knowing The Cross of Christ
sermons.description: Alan Martin shares on the death and resurrection of Christ and what that implies for every believer. We are called to "know" what truly the death of Christ means to us as believers. He preaches on the full truth of what the death of Christ speaks to us today. Many pulpits are preaching half truths that there is just a covering for sin and not a doing away of sin and victory over sin.

sermons.title: Lavish Giving, Loving Guests, Living Christ
Laws Of The Spiritual Life #2 - The Law Of Humility
sermons.description: Have you been perpetually defeated by sin and can't seem to get the victory?  Brother Zac shares the pathway of genuine holiness through humility and honesty.

sermons.title: Life and Death Struggle Which Will You Serve
sermons.description: This is one of the best messages I've heard on the struggle between the carnal and spiritual natures in a Christian. The one that wins will determine your eternal destiny. And here's a sobering thought: the one you feed the most is the one that will win. The key is in Gal. 5:24

sermons.title: Live Peaceably with All, If Possible
Lord Let Your Fire Fall!
sermons.description: Brother Edgar shares a convicting message from the exhortation of brother Paul the Apostle to be a living sacrifice. He shares the old Testament type of what a sacrifice is and how the Lord is calling us in the New Covenant to be a sacrifice for our Lord. He shares many sins and reasons why we do not allow ourselves to be a sacrifice. Brother Edgar can be contacted at: edgarreich@revivalusacanada.org

sermons.title: Love Is a Fulfilling of the Law, Part One
Love Is a Fulfilling of the Law, Part Three
Love is a Fulfilling of the Law, Part Two
MORE THAN CONQUERORS
sermons.description: We can see God at work in the lives of those who love Him, as He makes them into conquerors. Our lives needn’t be marked by one defeat after another! “Losers will be winners.” Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Malachi #2: I Have Loved You
sermons.description: Ed Miller shows how one's theology of God's love can be correct, but when the "devourer" comes, we can begin to hold God's love in suspicion in our innermost being.  He shows how doubting the love of God leads to a series of other problems.

sermons.title: Man as You Are
sermons.description: Where many Christians are utterly content to only embrace the forgiveness of God, there remains a severe ignorance of God’s full intent through the power of Christ.  Before one becomes a partaker of the divine nature, Major Thomas expounds what man in fact is.  We discover he is a living soul wrapped in flesh, needing the Spirit of God to breathe life into his Spirit.  Once the man is forgiven his goal must become, through grace, to allow and yield the Spirit’s infiltration into jis soul and flesh that he may become an instrument of righteousness.

sermons.title: Meet Your Psychiatrist: He Gives You Real Life
Meet Your Psychiatrist: He Sets You Free
Meet Your Psychiatrist: He Teaches You to Pray
Men Whose Eyes Have Seen The King - Part 3
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 08/01/1959.

sermons.title: National Moral Degeneracy (2)
sermons.description: We have received many blessings from the hand of God as a nation and have much to give Him thanks for; yet as a nation we have not been living as those mindful of God's kindness to us and of our accountability to God. Instead, we have turned away from listening to God and His word into paths of unrighteousness. One of the most aggravated sins of moral degeneracy of our nation is that of the unrequited blood of murdered multitudes. Our nation is stained with an ocean of blood that cries to God for His vengeance. In this opening up of God's Word to our nation, we hear God's rebuke and denunciation for our nation's aggravated sins and a call to repentance and prayer.

sermons.title: New Life Baptist Church - Part 1
sermons.description: In this first message, Paul takes us deeply into these verses in Romans. Learn, in depth, the meaning behind such words as justified, redemption, sacrifice and propitiation. These definitions will enrich your Christianity and humble you even more before your God.

sermons.title: New Life Baptist Church - Part 2
sermons.description: Speaking mostly to young people, Paul addresses a variety of issues. He encourages them to be separate from the world, to seek and to know the Lord, and to build their lives on the perceptive will of God as is found in the Word. He then finishes with a convicting message on relationships, courtship and the wisdom of fleeing youthful lusts.

sermons.title: New Life Baptist Church - Part 7
sermons.description: In this message, Paul deeply explores marriage and how God intends it as yet another method in conforming us to the image of His Son. He brings a freshness to this subject and the controversial debates that whirl around some Scriptures. A must for everyone who is married or anyone who has an inclination down that path.

sermons.title: O BLESSED CROSS!
sermons.description: Do our lives bear witness to God’s reality? Perhaps we can testify with gratitude about how we've experienced His love and strength at certain times in our lives. But how did we react when He laid a burden or a cross upon us? Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: OUR HEAVENLY FATHER CARES
sermons.description: God enjoys doing good things for His children. And He takes an interest even in our smallest concerns! In this meditation, we will hear about a woman in Switzerland who experienced this wonderful reality.

sermons.title: OUR HEAVENLY FATHER CARES
sermons.description: God enjoys doing good things for His children. He takes an interest even in our smallest concerns! In this program we will hear about a woman in Switzerland who experienced this wonderful reality.

sermons.title: Obtaining The Fullness of The Blessing of Christ
Offer Your Bodies A Living Sacrifice
sermons.description: Paul Washer powerfully shares an exposition of Romans chapter 12 verse 1 on offering our life as a true sacrifice to God. He clearly shows that it must in light of the work of mercy and justification that God offers through His Son Jesus Christ. This is a powerful message calling for full surrender and holiness to the Lord.

sermons.title: Offering Your Bodies
sermons.description: In a continuation of his teaching in "Joy of Giving it All", Paul expounds further on why our bodies are to be a holy sacrifice onto the Lord. Revisiting his themes of dying to self and the holiness of God, he challenges listeners again to separate from the world and onto God. Yet, in humbleness, he also encourages that any walk of surrender to Him must be done in complete dependence upon Him as Lord of all.

sermons.title: Oh The Depth
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 12/01/1958.

sermons.title: Open Air Street Preaching in Spanish
Our Nation’s Sexual Sins (3)
sermons.description: Our Nation is in serious spiritual need but in God's word, the Bible, we find answers to our moral and social problems as a nation. Sadly these days, our Nation is marked not only by an unrestrained and unashamed abandonment to sensuality but also by the putrid sin of sexual perversion. What is called sexual orientation and an alternative lifestyle today, God has always called an abomination, which he visits with severe judgment but from which he offers salvation.  In this message from God's Word to our Nation, we hear God's rebuke and denunciation for our nation's aggravated moral sins and a call to repentance and prayer. There is cleansing in the blood of Christ for all of our sexual sins. 1 Corinthians 6:9-11

sermons.title: Outpouring in Papua New Guinea (Part 1)
sermons.description: This is the account of a Missionary that went to Papua New Guinea and saw a 'People Movement' where hundreds of tribes people were converted to Christ (and not by the standards of today's easy-believism). A very powerful account of God's grace reaching an unreached people.

sermons.title: Overcoming Evil With Good
sermons.description: An exposition on Romans 12:9-21. The theme of "overcoming evil with good" is the master and overriding principle of this passage of scripture. This principle goes deeper than what is seen at first appearance.

sermons.title: PERSEVERING PRAYER
sermons.description: If you haven’t experienced God’s power in your life, perhaps it’s because you haven’t experienced the power of PERSEVERING PRAYER! What is persevering prayer, and why is it more likely to be answered than other kinds of prayer? Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Prayer Life of Paul for the Saints
sermons.description: Paul's unceasing prayer life for the saints demonstrated that he understood the worth and value of a human soul to God.  Smithers shows that prayerlessness bars access to people's hearts to further them in the Christian faith.  Do you pray for people?

sermons.title: Propitiation
sermons.description: This is a clear, pleading sermon with tears and brokenness over the precious doctrine of propitiation. This biblical message clearly portrays the gospel to a generation that is not used to or desiring to hear the hard plain truth.

sermons.title: Put on the Lord Jesus Christ, Part One
Put on the Lord, Jesus Christ, Part Two
Regeneration (Rora 2003)
sermons.description: Having begun in the Spirit.  Part 3 of 4; Regeneration, a change of nature.  Delivered at a conference in Devon UK.  “Session 3” examines the absolute necessity of being ‘born again’.  Is it ‘more than’ justification? It unpacks Romans 5 to discover the nature of ‘original sin’ and its only possible remedy.

sermons.title: Reigning in Life - Part 1
sermons.description: "If you're currently receiving the abundance of grace," says Alan Martin, "you're abounding in life."  Because all of the grace of God is in Christ, when you have Him, you have it all!  Our great need then is to grow through the ministry of the Holy Spirit in the awareness of what God has already given us in Christ.

sermons.title: Reigning in Life - Part 2
sermons.description: "This is something I long to be," says Alan Martin, "filled with the Spirit, led by the Spirit, dwelling in the Spirit, so that my wife, my children, my friends and all who know me see the incredible power of God in display daily."  Are we receiving this abundant provision of grace?  Are we just tasting of Christ or feast, just visiting or living in Him?

sermons.title: Reigning in Life - Part 3
sermons.description: Sin is not near as powerful as grace, yet so many believers live as slaves to sin and live under the reproach of Egypt.  "Grace is the very Person of Jesus Christ," says Alan Martin, "full of power, full of wisdom, full of glory, full of understanding, full of everything we need to be transformed from the likeness of Adam into the likeness of Christ."  This is not so much a sermon as it is a hunger and a desire for reality!

sermons.title: Reprobates and Trembling Nations
sermons.description: Carter Conlon delivers a powerful stirring rebuke and exhortation to this generation to seek God with a whole heart. There is misuse of the things of God in the churches and a lack of regard for the holiness of God in America. There are terrible times coming for America and this message proves a warning to many preachers who are preaching soft, small, slick messages in these last days.

sermons.title: Reprobates and Trembling Nations by Carter Conlon
sermons.description: Carter Conlon delivers a powerful stirring rebuke and exhortation to this generation to seek God with a whole heart. There is misuse of the things of God in the churches and a lack of regard for the holiness of God in America. There are terrible times coming for America and this message proves a warning to many preachers who are preaching soft, small, slick messages in these last days.

sermons.title: Revival - America's Only Hope
sermons.description: No discerning Christian living in 21st century America can deny that this country needs revival. The breakdown of public morals and the break-up of the traditional home are well-documented. It is no longer that America merely needs revival. She must experience it! The question is: “Is it too late?” Are we desperate enough to hold on to God and plead, “Wilt thou not revive us again?” Are we impatient or importunate? Do we wish for revival or do we will it? The hour is late, but God's mercy is great!

sermons.title: SUFFERING BRINGS GLORY
sermons.description: God looks down upon each one of His children. Nothing in our lives is hidden to Him. Nothing happens that He does not allow according to His wise, Fatherly will. God has an eternal goal for us. Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Shall We Continue In Sin?
sermons.description: If we are not born of God we have no freedom from sin. Our Lord Jesus has made us free from all power of sin. How then can we continue in sin as born again Christians? Unbelief, acceptance of sin in our lives, walking in the flesh and calling sin a "weakness" are things that keep us from a sin-free life, lived in joy and peace with God.

sermons.title: Sons and Daughters of God
sermons.description: In Hebraic life, a son is not a son until a certain condition is obtained before he ‘adopts’ him. And it is only sons and daughters who are qualified to fulfill the Last Day’s purposes of God. Only they have a single-eyed devotion to the will of the Father.

sermons.title: Steps To Personal Revival
sermons.description: Bill McLeod shares on the subject of a personal revival from the Word of God. He expresses clearly how the subject of revival and renewal is a very biblical topic and is needful for every Christian. He clearly shows how we can have revival, why we need revival and how to have a personal revival.

sermons.title: Steps To Personal Revival by Bill McLeod
sermons.description: Bill McLeod shares on the subject of a personal revival from the Word of God. He expresses clearly how the subject of revival and renewal is a very biblical topic and is needful for every Christian. He clearly shows how we can have revival, why we need revival and how to have a personal revival.

sermons.title: Stopping the Power of Darkness
sermons.description: Ravenhill gives an account of John Sung at the very end of this message. The testimony covers his academic success and then utter transformation upon conversion and filling of the Spirit. This message covers getting alone being still to hear God and what total consecration looks like. Spoken in the eve of abortion's legalization in Hawaii, he calls for people to walk in the measure of faith they been given with illustration from the testimony of Rees Howell purchasing the Bible school property.

sermons.title: Subjection to God and Subjection to the State, Part Four
Subjection to God and Subjection to the State, Part One
Subjection to God and Subjection to the State, Part Three
Subjection to God and Subjection to the State, Part Two
THE TRUTH MAKES US FREE
sermons.description: God lives and works today! But maybe you don’t feel that way right now. Is there no victory in your life even though you’ve accepted Christ as your Savior? Do you keep falling back into the same old sins? This meditation can help you.

sermons.title: TO TALK WITH THE FATHER
sermons.description: If you have a childlike relationship to God –  as your loving Father – you will experience His reality in every situation. But suppose you don’t have such a relationship. How can you enter into one? Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Thank You Lord
sermons.description: An ungrateful heart can lead us to away from God. So many times we look to Jesus for help and He comes through. But we should give the Lord thanks for what He has done in our lives. Luke 17:11-19; Romans 1:18- 21; Psalm 100:4

sermons.title: The 'All Things' that Work for Our Good
sermons.description: Such faithful exposition of God’s word causes one to ‘smile at the storm because of the assurance that Christ is in the vessel’ and very much in control of all things. What is meant to harm us turns out to make us exclaim like Hezekiah in Isaiah 38 that “surely it was for my benefit that I suffered such anguish”. We are still in this very rich verse that has spoken comfort to millions of Christians around the world and right across history—Romans 8:28.

sermons.title: The Agony and the Ecstasy of Paul in Romans 9-11
sermons.description: Why should the Church be preoccupied with God's chosen people, Israel? The reason is simply because if we do not, we will be contradicting and removing from the heart of God and His prophets, the very thing that was central to Him! This was the agony as well as the ecstasy of the apostle Paul in his epistle to the Romans. He tells us that if we are ignorant of this mystery, we are in danger of becoming wise in our own conceit. In this deeply-sobering and enlightening message, Art Katz shares on the mystery and the relationship the Church has with the Jews and how we are called to be agents of Israel's restoration!

sermons.title: The Ancient of Days on the Judgment Throne
sermons.description: This is a great revelation of prophetic truth. It is the sublime prophecy of Godâ€™s authority as Judge â€“ the Judge of all the earth, and the revelation of the supreme royal position of Christ, the Messiah. Daniel was Godâ€™s prophet during the period of Babylonian captivity. The Gentiles thought they were so mighty and powerful. Their despotic rulers and emperors thought they were independent of the God of heaven. The wicked nations thought that their kings had the ultimate and final authority. The kings and the princes of the Gentile world positioned themselves as if they were unpunishable. The prophecy here is a revelation from heaven that God, Who created the earth and all the inhabitants therein, has not abandoned the world to His creatures. This revelation upholds the truth known to patriarchs and prophets from the earliest of times that God is Judge. The God of heaven is â€œthe Judge of all the earthâ€ (Genesis 18:25).

sermons.title: The Book of Romans
sermons.description: This letter, the first in canonical order, but not the first of Paul’s Epistles, is the longest and the most influential of all the Apostle’s writings. Writing to Christians at Rome whom he hoped soon to visit, Paul presents to them his mature convictions concerning the Christian faith: the universality of sin; the impotence of the law as a means of salvation; the nature of God’s saving act in Christ, and its appropriation by faith. The letter closes with spiritual advice and some personal remarks.

sermons.title: The Call Of God - The Call To Holiness
sermons.description: "One of the things the law could not do," teaches Zac Poonen, "was to make a man holy on the inside."  Do you have the true freedom that the Holy Spirit gives, or are you more concerned with what people in your church will say, assessing your own spirituality or others by numerous unwritten laws or rules?  See what God's Word declares about true holiness which is a gift from God.

sermons.title: The Call Of God - To Know God
sermons.description: "God leads us," brother Zac shares, "higher and higher in the Christian life by giving us fresh revelations of Himself."  Knowing God as a God of love is the foundation of holiness and the way to perfection.  You know when you have a righteousness from God when it is coupled with the joy of the Holy Spirit!

sermons.title: The Cost of Discipleship
sermons.description: "95% of the Christians in America said they were one of two things: Either 'I am carnal' (a carnal christian) or number two 'I'm a babe in Christ'" Ravenhill preached his heart out to birth this sermon. I encourage you to watch the video. You can almost hear his heart pump with anguish for the precious souls who hear him. Let this be the sermon preached at your own funeral. Let your own funeral happen when you hear this sermon.

sermons.title: The Cross and the God of Hope
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 11/01/1958.

sermons.title: The Depth of His Riches
sermons.description: Erlo Stegen shows that in the Christian life through good times or hard times there is a depth of riches in Christ Jesus for every believer. Many stories, illustrations and examples are shown. This sermon is a very strong exhortation towards looking to our heavenly inheritance in Christ and our walk with Him in this earth.

sermons.title: The Discovering And Delighting In God's Will
The Divine Purpose and Principles of the Christian Life
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 01/01/1955.

sermons.title: The Gift of Righteousness
sermons.description: Preaching from Romans 5, Wilkerson preaches on God’s wonderful gift of righteousness.  This passage of Scripture consumed David for months and he studied it from every angle.  This is absolutely the best sermon on this topic of righteousness that I have heard, separating real righteousness from much of the emotional righteousness that many seem to subscribe to this day. Jesus said you would know the truth and the truth shall set you free. Sanctification is the Spirit of Christ in us making us to become what God in reality sees you to be already, by faith. Making us what we could never be on our own, holy. The gift of righteousness is the Spirit of Christ in you. When you yield to him and let him have control, he makes you what he is. The Lord doesn't want you to come to him in condemnation and guilt. He wants the truth of his righteousness and his love to set you free.

sermons.title: The Gifts of the Spirit
sermons.description: We see how all have at least one gift of the Spirit, how there are many different gifts, but all are from the same Spirit. We see how the gifts cannot be used properly but in accordance with scripture, and how that they will be used for the edification of believers and cannot profit selfish gain. Pastor Fitch talks mostly about the most contentious gift that of Tongues. We also see how no one person has all the gifts of the Spirit but we are supposed to have all the fruits of the Spirit.

sermons.title: The Gospel is the Power of God
sermons.description: This message was preached August 24, 2008 at Valley Church in Smithfield, Utah. "For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth; to the Jew first, and also to the Greek. For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith: as it is written. The just shall live by faith." (Romans 1:16-17) The Gospel which saves us is the power of God and the wisdom of God; for no one was saved by their own power, nor their own wisdom, but by the working alone of God's mighty power. The greatest need of man is righteousness with God, but it is also his greatest impossibility. Only through the Gospel is that righteousness secured, not by the strength and will of the flesh, but by the power and wisdom and God.

sermons.title: The Gospel of Jesus Christ: A Burden for Young People
sermons.description: God gave Paul a special burden for the young people at this service. About 10 young people professed Christ within the days following this service. Many years later, about 5 of them were still living out that profession. Thus, Paul's warnings in this sermon about continuing in the faith were well justified.

sermons.title: The Great Day of Their Wrath
sermons.description: An evangelistic warning to flee from the wrath of God to come and to turn to Jesus Christ who alone can deliver guilty, hell-deserving sinners from divine wrath; based on Revelation 6:17.

sermons.title: The Greatest Text in the Bible
sermons.description: Paul Washer preaches from what he calls the greatest text in the Bible to show God's wonderful plan of redemption. Using many illustrations, he speaks of the sinfulness of man, the holiness of God, the magnitude of of His love for us, and the splendor of redemption. Yet, in his own words, he was still unable to "preach Christ the way He ought to be preached". Listen to this powerful message.

sermons.title: The Heaven Side of Unyielding Prayer
sermons.description: Jesus tells us to "pray and faint not."  This message brings to light the reasons why we often "faint" in prayer. We must come to the Lord with a WHOLE heart - and not TRY Him, but SERVE Him, because He is GOD. Many do not get through to God because they are seeking their own agenda, or their own personal well being rather than the purpose of Christ. The reason so many walk in confusion is because of this refusal to submit to God. Why do Christians not pray as they should? Are they not totally surrendered to following Jesus? Do they not understand the heart of God and his love for them? This unjust judge had authority in Luke 18 over this widow woman's adversary, and she knew her rights, and she did not give up. The devil accuses us, pointing out our faults, and God avenges us by giving us the very thing we lack, when we seek him for it. God delights in his children and will rise up to deliver them when they are under attack.  Another wonderful encouragement to prayer.

sermons.title: The Indwelt Saint
sermons.description: Ravenhill discusses the freedom from sin a Christian should walk in and what it truly means to be filled with the Holy Spirit. He also shares some personal testimony from his own life near the end of the sermon.

sermons.title: The Israel of God - Part 2
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 08/01/1956.

sermons.title: The Israel of God - Part 4
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 08/01/1956.

sermons.title: The Journey From Prayer To Obedience
sermons.description: (Preached: Feb. 8th, 2004). In a place of complacency, the enemy rose up to try to destroy God's people. After the captivity in Babylon, many of Israel had grown comfortable and stayed, rather than returning. Mixture in the world gives the enemy room to rise up and rule over you. Esther fasted and prayed, but she then had to get up and go to the king. We, as the Body of Christ, need to remember we are ambassadors of Christ, and there is no time for games. Jesus is coming, and we need to come out from among the world, and seperate ourselves for his purposes. If you are struggling with your flesh, this message will help you, and hopefully motivate you. Esther risked her life to intercede for her people. We need to risk whatever will come into our lives whether persecution, or trouble, to be seperated to God's purposes.

sermons.title: The Joy of Giving it All (Part 1)
sermons.description: In his typical fashion, Paul presents a sermon on what he calls a key scripture. In this message, he encourages believers to give their whole lives to Christ and to explore the inexhaustible mercies of God.

sermons.title: The Joy of Giving it All (Part 2)
sermons.description: Have you put yourself at the disposal of God? In a continuation of his message, Paul specifies what it truly means to "present" oneself to God and the true joy He gives as you draw nearer to Him.

sermons.title: The Kingdom of God Is Righteousness and Peace and Joy in the Holy Spirit
The Liberating Law of the Spirit of Life
The Lord's Controversy Concerning Zion
sermons.description: Zion represents the overcoming, last days church. Not everybody who says Lord, Lord is going to make it in. Those who have been in the heavenly places with Christ, and are overcoming believers. They are overcoming the flesh, the devil, and the world. They walk in the power of the Spirit and their heart is not here but in heaven with Jesus, and their mind is on heavenly things. God has a controversy when the nations of this world mistreat His Son's Body. Sinners and hypocrites in Zion will be afraid when God begins to move and shake things. They won't be prepared for there is no security unless you are IN CHRIST. Unless your life is hid in Him, and you are dead to this world and it's vain attractions. The enemy is coming in like a flood against God's people, but remember, He sits, as KING of the flood.

sermons.title: The Meaning of Life - 5. From Romans 7 to Romans 8
The Mystery of Israel (A 1999 convocation tape)
sermons.description: Art probes the perplexity of the mystery of Israel given in Romans 11 and Psalm 102.  It is a mystery that profoundly affects the contemporary Gentile church and the only mystery that carries a penalty for our willful ignorance of it.

sermons.title: The Patience and Longsuffering of God
The Potter and the Clay
sermons.description: McGee examines the picture of the “potter” and “clay” to look at the truthful relationship between God and mankind. He notes that God created man from the dust of the Earth while saying “Let us make man in our own image.” Even though man is merely a created being, man no longer recognizes God’s right and authority to form and shape his creation according to the “pleasure of his own will.” Yet, rather then a call to become passive and fatalistic, this sermon is a call for faithful obedience and trust just as God is faithful to never remove us from his potters wheel.

sermons.title: The Potter's Power Over the Clay
sermons.description: This message was preached on October 5, 2008 at Valley Church in Smithfield, Utah. "Hath not the potter power over the clay, of the same lump to make one vessel unto honor, and another unto dishonor?" Delivered with much "fear and trembling", this sermon is an exegesis of Romans 9:14-29 and an examination of the God's sovereign election in salvation. There is so much misunderstanding and confusion that surrounds the issue of election, and my hope is that this message will clear much of that away. The Church must not be ashamed of, or apologize for, God, and one of the greatest hindrances to our coming into the fullness of the stature of Christ is our failure to embrace this essential God glorifying truth: that salvation is all of God and not of man.

sermons.title: The Power of Sin
sermons.description: Pastor Hession reveals that this chapter of Romans is the charter for the freedom of the saints.  First the dominion of sin is the guilt of sin which is the same as the power of sin, sin has power over us when we feel the guilt that comes with it, and the passage of time does nothing to releave the power of sin over us to make us feel condemned.  Secondly to be under the Law means that we are trying to please God by trying to keep the moral Law which cannot be done thus the law is the power of sin, as we try and keep the law and fail the guilt , or power, of sin increases on us, we thus end up feeling so condemned that we think that bit of extra sin cannot make a bad situation worse.  Thirdly though despite all this we are under grace, not the dominion of sin, neither the law but grace!  The grace of God is shown in that even though we deserve Hell He gives us love and mercy.  Finally to reckon ourselves dead to sin means to realise sin has no more power to condemn us because of the work of the Lord Jesus on the cross of calvary.

sermons.title: The Power of Travailing Prayer by Mark Greening
sermons.description: This message delivered by Mark Greening is a powerful exhortation to true prayer and intercession that brings revival. With testimonies of God working just months before and examples of church history of such praying. With many scriptures given to substantiate this type of praying we are helpless but to say we have not such a conception of praying in our day. Oh may we humble ourselves and let our Master teach us afresh what it means to "travail."

sermons.title: The Power of Travailing Prayer by Mark Greening
sermons.description: This message delivered by Mark Greening is a powerful exhortation to true prayer and intercession that brings revival. With testimonies of God working just months before and examples of church history of such praying. With many scriptures given to substantiate this type of praying we are helpless but to say we have not such a conception of praying in our day. Oh may we humble ourselves and let our Master teach us afresh what it means to "travail."

sermons.title: The Present Effects of Trembling at the Wrath of God
The Revelation Of Christ In Life
sermons.description: Ed Miller dissects the "noisiest psalm in the Bible" to show true spiritual mindedness knows the secret of a panic free life.  "Is God in control?  Is He in remote control?" he asks.  Not at all, but the God of Jacob is a very present help in time of trouble.

sermons.title: The Snare of the Folwer
sermons.description: This Psalm depicts Israel escaping the snare of the fowler, which is a figure of the redeemed being freed from the entrappings of sin by the gracious hand of the Lord Jesus.  The power of sin over the christian, or anyone, is it's ability to condemn and maintain our guilt before the law of God, we can go on for years under the power of a sin that we may only have commited once, this is the sanre designed by Satan himself and the more we try and work our way free the tighter it becomes and the more condemned we feel trying to live up to the law in order to please God.  But praise God for the Lord Jesus who took upon Himself the wieght of sin and not only that but became my sin and yours for us, He alone could have exhausted the power of sin and the law over us and so He alone can free us from it's grasp.

sermons.title: The Sovereignty of God
sermons.description: Mack presents the truth of God's sovereignty in simplicity and passion.

sermons.title: The Surrendered Life
sermons.description: Many of us make the claim that we live life totally committed to God but is that the complete truth.  Do we really give up body and possessions completely to God?  This is a message that should convict all who love God with all of their heart, soul, and mind.

sermons.title: The True Gospel
sermons.description: Paul preached to about 700 youth at a VCY America Rally on 2/09/08. This is a similar presentation of the message brother Paul delivered many years ago to the youth and was never asked back. The truth of the Gospel brought a great soberness to the event and you can see people on the edge of their seats listening to this man of God share the true biblical gospel.

sermons.title: The Voice of Conscience
sermons.description: One of the devil's tricks is to bring his own people into religious debates. From these "dialogs," we get a 'redefining" of God's Word. We get a "redefinition" of sin. We get a redefinition of Truth. There is even a redefinition of the voice of the conscience. Some worldly philosophers define conscience as the culmination of all the good behaviors learned over childhood from parents. But the Scriptures talk about conscience as being from God. Paul speaks of it by name in Romans 2:15 and Romans 9:1. And, as Dr. Tozer points out in this message, the voice of the conscience is always on God's side, never the world's.

sermons.title: The Voice of God's Love
sermons.description: The Earth is a lost world and humans are a lost people. But we're not "lost" because God doesn't know where we are. Rather all creation "groans" under the burden of sin and we are lost because of it. In spite of that, however, God's voice constantly calls us to come to Him -- to rest in the safety of His sheltering arms. Dr. Tozer tells of a God who so loves His creation so much that He offers both love and hope, even though we are hopelessly lost.

sermons.title: The Voice of Gods Judgement
sermons.description: According to Dr. Tozer, Christians have a tendency to hold fast to one truth at the expense of another. Then, after a time, someone comes along and preaches the forgotten Truth -- as Martin Luther did with the doctrine of justification by faith. He was first considered a heretic for peaching an unfamiliar (actually, forgotten) doctrine, but it marked the beginning of the reformation of the church. Has justification by faith now overshadowed other truths, like the inevitability of God's judgment? Dr. Tozer explores this possibility and reaches some disturbing conclusions.

sermons.title: The Wrath Of God
sermons.description: This message was preached on August 30th, 2009, at Valley Church in Smithfield, Utah. "For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men." (Romans 1:18) Foundational to the gospel as well as to the whole Bible, the reality of the wrath of God has almost become a thing of embarrassment for many Christians, but if we do not know God as the God revealed in Scripture - a God of wrath - then we really do not know God at all. God's wrath is as much a divine perfection as His love, and therefore it is something marvelous for us to rejoice in.

sermons.title: The right use of the Law
sermons.description: Starting in Romans 3:19-31, this sermon shows the purpose and necessity of the Law in producing genuine conversion. Although all can recall wrongdoing, the Law has been given to convict us of sin -- to show the enormity of our crime against a holy, just, and righteous God. Until we are convicted of our crime and cry out to be free, the Gospel of salvation holds no real meaning. Unfortunately, most preaching over the last 100 years has not started with the Law but has instead been offering a Gospel to people who are really unaware from what they must be saved. The Holy Spirit has thus been stripped of "the only tool He has ever used to prepare men for Grace." The Law was never intended for Salvation, but to reveal the character of both God and man and to point to man's need of Christ. A must-listen.

sermons.title: Unashamed of the Gospel Amidst Our Culture
sermons.description: Paul Washer uses examples from within his own denomination to reveal what is true of so many places that call themselves churches, with regard to (1) the ways in which Biblical and historical Christianity has been reduced to an impotent and empty creed, and (2) the effects of this reduction upon the people who are influenced by it. But whilst casting down false strongholds, he is also faithful to build up that which is true, clearly setting out what is the TRUE gospel of Christ, of which the Apostle was not ashamed. When that gospel is preached, we should be asking men, not “Do you know you’re a sinner?” but “Has God so worked in your heart that the sin you once loved you now hate?”; not “Have you made a decision?” but “Has God worked in your heart?”; not “Do you want to go to heaven?” but ”Has God so worked in your heart that you now esteem him worthy above all things, and desire HIM?”. Mr Washer includes examples of some Godly conversions, which clearly bear the fruits of  that miraculous and supernatural repentance and regeneration which are the work of God alone. (50 minutes).

sermons.title: Urge To Sin - The Mental Factor
Use the Inspired Scriptures to Rejoice in Hope
Walk worthy of your calling
sermons.description: The hour has come to wake up from our sleep, and we must act as we read in verse 11. There is something God commands that we do. Each one should awake out of their sleep. Some are quite awake physically but fast asleep spiritually. There are those who think Christmas is a time to booze, or a time to give way to their passions. Others put up beautiful decorations, but they don't know what Christmas is about. But at Christmas we celebrate the birth of the Son of our Heavenly Father into this world, who became man. He wasn't born in a palace, but in a smelly stable with animals.

sermons.title: We Shall All Stand Before the Judgement Seat of Christ
sermons.description: If you listen to this message and you do not have a greater awe and reverence for God, then listen to it again because you didn’t get it. The most sobering truth in the bible is the teaching of the judgement seat of Christ and nothing is more neglected in modern day Christiandom.

sermons.title: We Will All Stand Before the Judgment of God
Welcome One Another for the Glory of God
What Is The Gospel?
sermons.description: Most people in churches today have a false understanding of the Gospel. We associate it with things that are really the law. In this Sermon, Dr. Baucham discusses what the Gospel is "not" and what the Gospel "is".

sermons.title: What Is The Normal Christian Life?
What Will Keep You on the Mission Field?
What is Conscience
sermons.description: Brother Orr searches and explains exhaustively on what exactly the conscience is, what it does, and what can happen to it by ignoring it. "But somebody else said to me,'Your conscience teaches right from wrong.' Does it? Always? The Scripture doesn't teach that. The Scripture speaks of a pure conscience, it often speaks of a rotten conscience."

sermons.title: When Is It Right to Repay Evil With Pain?
When Jacob Met the Apostle Paul
When Jacob Met the Apostle Paul
Who's Slave Are You?
sermons.description: Everyone is a slave to something or someone, who are you a slave to? What do you think about most? Paul Washer shares his heart on this very strong subject and potent scripture. What depths there are in every verse of scripture, hear brother washer share on Romans 1:1.

sermons.title: Why Christ Became a Servant of the Jews
Why Does God Allow Suffering?
sermons.description: If one were to walk into a cathedral in Cologne, and he noticed that there were holes in the walls, and that some of the flying buttresses had been detached from their intended place by bombs, nobody would assume that the architect had been a fool for designing the building the way it was in its present condition.  So also we must recognize that, being made as “gods” (John 10:34) we were given the free will to choose our present condition.  God is not to be blamed for the suffering we have chosen, neither is He to be blamed for the wreckage as a result of it.  Just as our Lord was, so also we need to be perfected through sufferings.  Suffering offers mankind the option to change.  We were cast out of eternity into time so that our decision could be corrected, and Jesus came and suffered for us so that we could be reconciled.

sermons.title: Winning, Winning, Winning
sermons.description: Are you testifying about the Lord?  Mark Cahill shows how souls are won through properly using the law (such as the Ten Commandments) to bring a person to see they are a "complete, total pagan sinner".  Then and only then can one truly see their need for a Savior in Jesus Christ.

sermons.title: Ye Shall Be Free Indeed!
sermons.description: Keith Daniel's shares the truth of the Bible that God desires to save men. He shows from scriptures the need for repentance on the behalf of men and God's heart breaking over lost men. He goes on to share 3 powerful stories of God's saving power to the lowest drug addicts and alcoholics. God can save to the uttermost surely!

sermons.title: You Can Fulfill God's Perfect Plan
sermons.description: Sacrifice and Sovereignty is the balance of Chrstian Life. Painful self-denial and submitting our wills to God ensure we have walked in the perfect will of God. Amongst all the problems and doubts we can trust a loving Heavenly Father that He is desiring and leads us into His perfect will for our life's. Into a life full of good works that glorifies the death of Christ for our sins giving us eternal life.

sermons.title: You Can Fulfill God's Perfect Plan by Zac Poonen
sermons.description: Sacrifice and Sovereignty is the balance of Chrstian Life. Painful self-denial and submitting our wills to God ensure we have walked in the perfect will of God. Amongst all the problems and doubts we can trust a loving Heavenly Father that He is desiring and leads us into His perfect will for our life's. Into a life full of good works that glorifies the death of Christ for our sins giving us eternal life.

sermons.title: Your Ultimate Purpose
sermons.description: Paul Washer shows that the sovereignty of God begins not with our salvation, not even with our birth, but before the foundation of the world, when God predestinated us to our ultimate purpose. Few people know, with real, unshakeable certainty, that everything is working together for good. If you don’t believe it, you probably have the wrong definition of good. Are you discontented? Are you shaken by adversities, or the removal of blessings and comforts? Mr Washer uses these verses to reveal the causes and the remedy. God has made us sons and daughters, a high calling indeed; yet whilst we certainly benefit, the prime beneficiary is God’s son. God is making brothers and sisters for his son, a fellowship of those who stand in awe of their elder brother and worship him; and we can only worship him truly if we are conformed to his image. We have to be made like him to know how worthy he is; and the more we know him, the more we will be drawn to worship him. Is God’s ultimate purpose your purpose? Is your eye single in this respect? If not, Mr Washer explains what you should do.  (29 minutes)
